@graph.title: Thermal protective clothing for firefighters
@graph.abstract: 1.Introduction --1.1.A brief background on thermal protective clothing for firefighters --2.Fires and thermal environments --2.1.Uncontrolled fires --2.2.Thermal environments faced by firefighters --3.Skin burn injuries and heat stress/fatalities --3.1.Burn injuries --3.2.Heat stress/fatalities --3.3.Present scenario on firefighter injuries and fatalities in the United States --4.Development of high performance thermal protective clothing --4.1.Development of fire-retardant/resistant fibers --4.2.Development of high performance fabrics --4.3.Development of thermal protective clothing --5.Performance evaluation of thermal protective clothing --5.1.Softening/melting temperature and flammability evaluation --5.2.Thermal protective performance evaluation --5.3.Clothing comfort (physiological) evaluation --6.Modeling and its implications on performance of thermal protective clothing --6.1.Heat and/or mass transfer models --6.2.Metabolic heat and/or sweat-vapor transfer models --6.3.Further research directions --7.Effects of various factors on performance of thermal protective clothing --7.1.Fiber properties --7.2.Yarn Properties --7.3.Fabric properties --7.4.Clothing features --8.Key issues related to thermal protective clothing --8.1.Thermal protective performance evaluation --8.2.Design of thermal protective clothing.
